result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christine Ann Karr

records.addlTxt: Per e-mail from Ginny Tetzlaff, Credit Management, defendant is NOT deceased.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Per call from defendant's sister Nicole Karr (414) 930-9265 or (414)-484-4059 defendant passed away on May 3, 2016 in California.
Defendant did not appear for the previously scheduled plea date.  Warrant for violation of bail conditions was issued on September 1, 2015.  Bench warrant to remain in effect.
Justice Point Discharge Summary Report received and filed.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

BRANCH 26 FOR BRANCH 21.  Attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor in court.  James C. Griffin for Megan Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for Justice Point Violation.   Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  Court forfeits no bail at this time.  Court does not vacate next scheduled court date, however, the Court orders hearing be changed to a projected guilty plea.
JusticePoint Violation Report received and filed.

Defendant Christine Ann Karr in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Jeremy Arn for Michael Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Status conference conducted.  Parties may have reached a resolution.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 28, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Christine Ann Karr in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for status conference. Defense is still waiting for an offer. Another status conference was agreed upon. Case adjourned to Branch 21.  Status conference scheduled for August 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Christine Ann Karr in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Jeremy R. Arn for Megan Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense is still waiting for an offer. Case adjourned for status in Branch 21.  Status conference scheduled for July 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Christine Ann Karr in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Joanne Hardtke for Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.   Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and Court entered a not guilty plea on behalf of the defendant. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 21.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 7, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 6/12/15.
